Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed, is covered with a brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394662) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394662)
